awd_titl_txt: REU Site: Scripps Undergraduate Research Fellowship (SURF)
awd_abstract_narration:
The Division of Ocean Sciences provides support via this award for a Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU) program at the University of California San Diego's Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO) located in La Jolla, CA. The program supports a 10-week summer internship program that invites sixteen undergraduate students from across the country to Scripps to participate in high quality collaborative research with Scripps faculty and researchers.  

The breadth of ocean-related sciences at Scripps makes it accessible to students from practically all science and engineering disciplines, including physics, chemistry, geology, mathematics, ecology, physiology, molecular/biotechnology, environmental sciences and technology/computer science. Program components include a comprehensive research project, research seminars, career workshops, graduate school preparation, field trips, and participation in a final research symposium. Students receive a stipend, travel funding to attend the program and housing for the duration of the program. Students may receive support to present their research at scientific conferences. The goal of this REU site is to attract and retain a diverse pool of talented undergraduate students in marine and earth science and related fields.

inst.inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SITE-Res Exp for Ugrd Site
REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp

por.por_cntn:
The overarching goal of the Scripps Undergraduate Research Fellowship (SURF) REU is to recruit and retain talented and diverse students in earth, ocean and atmospheric sciences and related fields. The SURF program is commited to recruiting and involving students from groups that are traditionally underrepresented in the geosciences and for whom the REU experience will likely have the most impact in terms of career development, including students who might have struggled with their coursework but nevertheless show promise in research applications and students who have not yet had access to research opportunities or applications in geosciences.

The SURF summer REU program has four specific aims: (1) to improve undergraduate students’ academic preparedness (knowledge and skills) to conducte scientific research, (2) improved students' confidence in their ability to conduct scientific research, (3) to increase students’ attitudes and interest in the geosciences (earth, ocean and atmospheric sciences) and related fields, and (4) to increase students' likelihood to pursue careers in geosciences and related fields.

In summer 2020, the SURF program also received a supplemental grant to host an additional virtual version of the SURF program in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. This virtual SURF program ran concurrently with the existing SURF program. For the remainder of this report, we will refer to these two concurrent programs as the "SURF program" and the "virtual SURF program."


 


Last Modified: 05/20/2024
Modified by: Lisa Tauxe
